svg.text:
This demo shows how to benefit from both of the short links and long links in a network with rich local connections and some remote connections. Each sensor node implements a routing algorithm based on local information to deliver a message via a short path.
When you run the demo, the initiator move randomly and imit a signal that can only be detected by sensors within a certain range from it. When a sensor detect the signal it will report to the base station. The message is routed via a short path according to the routing algorithm. A node turns to be green for one second if it is on the routing path and receives the message. Modify the "exponent" parameter to see different behavior.
Receive the signal and display it:
Set to red if the signal is transmitted by 1 hop.
